task_summary: Remove the pot lid, place the pot onto the plate, then push the pot toward the front edge using the spatula tool.

task_long_description.overview: A tabletop scene shows a robot arm, a small pot with a removable lid, a round plate, a spatula-like tool, and a countertop with burner markings. The robot must first take the lid off the pot and set it aside safely. Next, it should pick up the pot and place it accurately on the plate. Finally, using the spatula as a tool, the robot pushes the pot forward toward the tableâ€™s front edge, ensuring stable contact and avoiding collisions with nearby items.
preconditions: Workspace clear around pot, plate, and tool
Gripper functioning and empty at start
Spatula tool reachable on the table
Plate provides a stable placement area
stepwise_plan: Detect pot, lid, plate, and tool
Grasp and lift off the lid; place it on the table
Grasp the pot and place it onto the plate
Use spatula to push the pot toward the front edge
success_criteria: Pot centered on plate within small pose error
Pot pushed toward front edge by the commanded distance
failure_and_recovery: If detection fails, rescan or adjust view
If grasp slips, reopen gripper and recompute grasp
If placement unstable, regrasp and reseat pot
If tool push stalls, re-approach and push again with smaller distance
task_long_description.termination: Terminate when the pot is on the plate and has been pushed forward, with the arm safely retreated.

frame_3.now_evidence: Robot end-effector closely aligned above the small pot/lid area, indicating imminent grasp or manipulation.
frame_3.predicts_next: Suggests the next action is lifting the lid or moving the pot, aligning with the planned sequence.

task_instruction: Take the lid off the pot, put the pot on the plate, and use the tool to push to pot to the front of the table.

node_specs.description: Detect the pot pose for subsequent grasping.
Detect the lid to prepare for removal.
Move above the lid with clearance.
Compute a top grasp for the lid.
Grasp the lid using the computed pose.
Lift the lid off the pot.
Place the lid on the table surface.
Compute a side grasp for the pot body.
Grasp the pot at the computed pose.
Lift the pot clear of the surface.
Place the pot on the plate pose.
Release the pot on the plate.
Use the spatula to push the pot toward the table front.
Final retreat to a safe pose.

failure_modes: Perception misses lid or pot due to occlusion
Lid sticks to pot causing failed lift
Pot slips during placement onto plate
Tool push causes pot to topple or collide with nearby items
recovery_strategy: Repeat detection or scan pattern and reattempt
Increase lift distance and retry grasp
Regrasp and reseat pot with higher press_force
Break push into smaller distances and re-approach
assumptions: Spatula is the available tool and is suitable for pushing
Front of table corresponds to direction 180 degrees in task frame
Plate pose is reachable and clear of obstacles
Frames suggest pot ends up near plate; exact push distance inferred

expected_success_criteria: Pot displaced toward front by at least commanded distance
No collisions and stable end pose
